name: 3-Hour Private Berlin Bike Tour: Vibes of Berlin
description: Discover the alternative Berlin with your private group and guide on a 3-hour bike tour along the banks of the river Spree. Pedal your way through colorful Berlin, stopping in the hip districts and learning about the city's history.

name: Berlin's hidden side (Available in English, Spanish)
shortDescription:
Esotericism and the third reich from a different point of view. Tired of always seeing the same tour about Hitler and his henchmen? What if I told you that there are several things they don't dare to talk about in the other tours?


At UnGatoConPasaporte we want to offer you quality tours, with content, something to make you discover history and encourage healthy debate during the experience. That's why we are pleased to share with all of you a premiere tour in the city: "The hidden face of Berlin". 


From the origins of Berlin in the Middle Ages as well as the point of view of religion at the time and its influence on the persecution of witches, through ghosts that for centuries terrorized the most influential families in Europe, including the Hohenzollern - German royal family until the end of the Great War.


We will visit the tomb of the Brothers Grimm where we will compare their original versions with Disney's. Later we will visit David Bowie's apartment, of which we are currently preparing a thematic tour.


We will learn about the history of the Holy Grail from the point of view of Catharism and how figures like Otto Rahn or Hanussen brought occultism and esotericism to reinforce (and fit) the thoughts of Himmler and Hitler. Perpetrators of National Socialism or forced by circumstances? And as a gift for the best groups, some of the theories about the escapes of some great SS officers.


In about two to three hours of walking, we will talk about all those stories that you have never been told in any freetour. Collaborate with your local freelancer and support the development of the following tours such as: West and East Berliners, two tours I am working on to bring you a unique, personalized form of entertainment, made by and for further dissemination and research in a time when over-information drowns us with a deafening noise that does not allow to stop for a moment to reflect and think.



A valid ticket is required for the AB zones, as the tour ends at Schöneberg.

For groups under 4 people, you can request a quote on a private tour

TANDEM VERSION

In order to be able to provide more tours, we have our bookings open for our tours in English and Spanish so that we reach the minimum amount of 5 assistants easily. Therefore, in case we have a TANDEM TOUR, the itinerary and content will remain the same, it will just take about an hour longer to finish. Feel free to contact us if you have any inquiries.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Third Reich and Berlin Wall History 3-Hour Bike Tour in Berlin
description: Enjoy a 3-hour bike tour and experience Berlin's 20th century history off the beaten tourist trail. Learn about the capitals history during the Nazi period, the construction of The Wall and daily life in East and West shown at original places.

name: 3-Hour Private Bike Tour of Tiergarten and Berlin's Hidden Places
description: Enjoy a private 3-hour bike tour through Berlin and see the city's hidden places and green ways -- even Berliners are amazed on this tour! See centrally located treasures and hear incredible stories. This tour is the perfect route for all who feel like Berlin experts or are searing for the unusual.

name: Private Berlin 3-Hour Bike Tour: Berlin's Best
description: Experience the City of Berlin by bike in a relaxing 3-hour guided tour. Get a perfect mixture of all the central sights of past and present, added with insights into original locations from the Cold War and Nazi-time. This tour is a perfect welcome to Berlin, as it offers a great synopsis of the German capital.

name: 3-Hour Alternative Berlin Bike Tour: Vibes of Berlin
description: Discover the alternative Berlin by bike on a 3-hour bike tour along the banks of the river Spree to the hip districts. See the famous colorful Berlin, a city in constant renewal and find out why the city is called "poor but sexy".

name: Potsdam Bike Tour with Rail Transport from Berlin
description: Take a day-trip from Berlin and discover UNESCO World Heritage listed Potsdam, all by the seat of your bike! From park lands to alleyways, you're English-speaking guide will recount historical anecdotes as you explore an array of Prussian and Cold War sites.

name: Berlin Bike Tour: Third Reich and Nazi Germany
description: How could the Germans allow Hitler's rise to power? Who, if anyone, stood in his way? What was known of the extent of the Holocaust, and what was done against the persecution of the Jews and others? What was life in Berlin like during the Third Reich and during the bombing of World War II? What happened in Berlin once the Soviets defeated the Nazis? Find out on this fascinating Berlin Bike Tour.

name: Berlin Segway Tour with Guide, Small Group
description: Get to know the highlights of Berlin on a 2-hour city tour by Segway. Following an expert guide, cruise around central Berlin to discover the city’s fascinating history and famous sights including Checkpoint Charlie, the Berlin Wall, the Holocaust Memorial and the Topography of Terror. Explore Potsdamer Platz, glide around Brandenburg Gate and enjoy trivia about Berlin along the way. Numbers are limited to 8 on this small-group tour, ensuring personalized attention from your guide.

name: 3-Hour Berlin Highlights Bike Tour
description: Enjoy a relaxed yet comprehensive 3-hour city tour introducing you to Berlin’s top sites.  You will see top attractions, such as the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Reichstag, and much more.  Discovering Berlin by bike is a truly memorable experience, and friendly English-speaking guides will captivate you with interesting stories and insights into the city.  This is the perfect tour for those looking to see the best Berlin has to offer in one concise tour.

name: BODY WORLDS Berlin
description:
The first BODY WORLDS museum presents a variety of unique plastinates that show the function of individual organs as well as common diseases. It gives insights into the highly complex structures of the human body and shows what connects us, keeps us upright and in motion, and what makes us laugh and love.
Moreover, the exhibition opens the visitors’ eyes to various facets that determine our existence.

name: Berlin Small-Group Segway Tour
description: Cruise effortlessly through Berlin's parks and sidewalks as you view the sites by Segway! A self-balancing, personal transportation device that's designed to operate in any pedestrian environment, your Berlin Segway Tour is limited in size (a maximum of 8 participants per guide), so you can count on an extremely personal experience.

name: Berlin 3-Hour Bike Tour: City-Center Welcome
description: Experience the awakening Berlin by bike in a relaxing 3-hour guided tour. Get a perfect mixture of all the central sights of past and present, added with insights into original locations from the Cold War and Nazi-time. This tour is a perfect welcome to Berlin, as it offers a great synopsis of the German capital.

name: Free Tour through the neuralgic avenue Unter den Linden (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
Walk/walk from Alexander Platz to the Brandenburg Gate along the nerve center and historic avenue Unter den Linden. Walking is more enjoyable, there is time to photograph and learn about the beautiful buildings and we also do sports! An unforgettable pass at our own pace, without rushing!

Points of interest:

  1. Berlin TV Tower (Fernsehturm)
  2. Berlin Cathedral (Berliner Dom)
  3. Altes Museum
  4. bebelplatz
  5. Brandenburg Gate
  6. Holocaust Memorial
  7. And many more!

Book with me and let's enjoy this beautiful walk full of history and architecture. Names, dates, curious facts and much more!

At the end of the tour (Brandenburg Gate) we will find ourselves face to face with the largest and most attractive park in Berlin, the Tiergarten! Where you can lose yourself for several hours and I will also give you all the necessary information so that you continue to discover the city, this time on your own.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The Original Berlin Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp Memorial Tour
description: Take a tour of the Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp with The Original Berlin Concentration Camp Memorial Tour. Discover the brutal history of the facility that was primarily used for political prisoners but also the administrative center of the Nazi concentration cap system.

name: Original Berlin Pub Crawl and Nightlife Clubbing tour
description:
This Original Berlin pub crawl is your ticket to the best night out in the city. Come crawl with us as we get into some of Berlin's best clubs, pubs, lounges, and dance halls.

Here is your ticket for a good night out! Need to know the best place to go? Don’t worry we have it covered. Come hang out with us, as we find our way into some of Berlin’s best nightlife!

name: Segway Sightseeing Tour Berlin
description: The Exclusive Segway Tour – is a trip, that we are definitely proud to present. Our best ideas are inside. Our guides are professionally prepared to teach you to drive Segway and are always ready to share with you the most interesting and exciting facts about the history of Berlin. You always have a possibility to choose one of several options, that we offer special for you. It’s an amazing way, how to spend time with your nearest, and enjoy the city at the same time.

name: 1-Hour Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
description:
Discover Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point

See the Brandenburg Gate, one of the best-known landmarks in Germany

Visit the Holocaust Memorial, a memorial in Berlin to the Jewish victims of the Holocaust

Enjoy the ride on Segway at Gendarmenmarkt, where you will see an architectural ensemble of concert hall and churches

name: 3 Hours Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
description:
Discover Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known Berlin Wall crossing point

Join to see the Brandenburg Gate, one of the best-known landmarks in Germany

Visit the Holocaust Memorial, a memorial in Berlin to the Jewish victims of the Holocaust

Explore the Reichstag building as well as the German Chancellery - places, where all the most important decisions are taken

Pass through the Rotes Rathaus, the town hall of Berlin, the home to the governing mayor and the government of the Federal state of Berlin

Enjoy Berlin Cathedral, one of the most beautiful churches in Germany

See the largest train station in all of Europe

name: A great day in Berlin with a private guide
description:
Welcome to amazing Berlin.

We are Guides of Berlin and together we will discover, understand and have a memorable experience of Berlin.

On this VIP tour, we will visit the landmarks of Berlin, go beyond the beaten track to discover the magic that lured people here throughout history.

Together we will explore the richness of Berlin's history, culture and beauty.

A great tour for your easy orientation to the city.

My aim is a memorable experience for you.

Among the landmarks we will cover are the following sites:

Checkpoint Charlie

The German parliament- Reichstag

The Brandenburg Gate

The holocaust memorial

The Berlin Wall

The site of Hitler's Bunker

Gendarmenmarkt

The location of the book burning

Museum Island

Hackescher markt

The Berlin Cathedral

and more

name: Guided tour of the Historic Center of Berlin (Available in Spanish)
description:
If you want to discover the historic center of Berlin in all its dimensions, this free walking tour is the one for you.
The visit is one of the most outstanding at a cultural and historical level that you can make in the city.
The visit to the historic center is a journey through time through the old and modern streets of the city; We will walk through those places that marked this city as one of the European epicenters of culture, science and tolerance, but also as one of the settings of the harshest dictatorships of the 20th century.
This visit will allow you to get to know not only the main monuments of the capital, including the memorial to the victims of the holocaust or the square of the sad burning of books, but also those that immerse the visitor in the most important events that occurred in the German capital. .

It is a tour that you can enjoy as a family through those places that become not only a trail of time and culture, but also a battle for memory and non-repetition.

PLACES AND MONUMENTS WE WILL VISIT ARE:

  • The Museum Island
  • Memorial to all the victims of wars and dictatorships // die neue Wache
  • The Opera Square or Bebelplatz
  • Tolerance Square and/or Gendarmenmarkt
  • The street of the Wilhemstrasse or street of Ministries
  • hitler's bunker
  • Memorial to the Jews
  • Unter den Linden street
  • The Brandenburg Gates


ESTIMATED TIME OF THE VISIT:
The visit has a maximum duration of 3 hours.

RECOMMENDATIONS :

  • Be 10 minutes before at the meeting point.
  • The visit will only be carried out with a minimum group of 6 people.
  • Transport ticket is not required.
  • Bring a good coat and appropriate clothing for walking and spending a long time outdoors.
  • Reservations of more than six adults are not accepted.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Freetour por el Centro Histórico de Berlín (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
La capital del III Reich y el epicentro de la guerra fría, el antiguo esplendor del Imperio Alemán de los Káiseres y la vibrante ciudad capitalina de República Federal. Berlín lo tiene todo, y durante nuestro tour vamos a explorar juntos este fascinante y polifacético legado. 

 Durante el paseo de 3 horas vamos a adentrarnos en el antiguo esplendor imperial de la ciudad, los lados oscuros de la dictadura nazi, las destrucciones de la Guerra Mundial como también la impresionante reconstrucción lograda durante la reunificación alemana. Nuestro tour comienza en el emblemático Hackescher Markt, llenos de bares y restaurantes donde suelen salir los berlineses. 

Luego nos trasladamos hacia la famosa Isla de los Museos donde nos conocen la dinastía Hohenzollern, bajo cuáles floreció el arte, cultura y la arquitectura de la ciudad. Admiraremos la Catedral Protestante, el Museo Antiguo y El Museo de Pérgamo paseando por las escénicas orillas del río Esprea.

Siguiendo por las calles más representativas Unter den Linden llegaremos al famoso Plaza Bebel, donde al asumir el poder los nazis quemaron más de 20 mil libros considerandos degenerados y dañinos para la raza aria. 

Después admiraremos la Gendarmenmarkt (Mercado de los Gendarmes). Es una plaza espectacular con las dos catedrales - Francesa y Alemana, donde conoceremos mejor la política de tolerancia religiosa de los monarcas prusianos. 

Continuamos hacia el Checkpoint Charlie aprovechando este punto de primera importancia histórica para hablar de las consecuencias de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, división de Berlín, construcción del Muro y de la Guerra Fría. 

Luego pasaremos por los lugares con la historia más oscura que es antiguo barrio gubernamental de los ministerios nazis y el búnker del Adolf Hitler. Caminaremos hacia el Monumento de Holocausto rindiendo homenaje a los millones de víctimas asesinado por los alemanes. 

Finalmente, admiraremos el parlamento alemán - Bundestag con su turbulenta historia, actualmente un podemos símbolo de la reunificación alemana. 

El tour confluye en frente de la Puerta de Brandeburgo, el verdadero emblema de la ciudad, que conecta el pasado con el futuro de esta increíble capital europea. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: The Rise of The Third Reich - Free Walking Tour (Available in English)
shortDescription:
A visitor to Germany at the start of the 20th Century would have believed that the next 100 years would be glorious. But something terrifying was lurking in the heart of this outwardly advanced nation. By 1945 Germans could look around them and barely see two bricks piled on top of one another. Their nation had become a synonym for cruelty. What happened?
On this fascinating free tour, we explore the roots of Hitler's evil empire. How did the Nazi party take an advanced, civilized nation, and turn it towards barbarism?
We will explore the missteps in the creation of Germany, the warning signs that were ignored, the roots of the Nazis' hateful antisemitism, the cultural revolution which allowed Hitler to force a fringe political idea into the daily lives of every German. We will discover how conspiracy theories and propaganda convinced a nation to follow a limited, irrational and paranoid man into oblivion. All this against the back drop of some of Berlin's most glorious historical sites.
Sites visited: 

Marienkirche
Neptune Fountain
Marx-Engels Memorial
Karl Liebknecht memorial
Neuer Marstall
The Royal Palace
Berlin State Library
Book burning memorial
Museum Island
Lust Garten
Prussian Armory/ German Historical Museum
Neue Wache, site of German remembrance. 



 Join me, a tour guide of over decade's experience as we trace the rise of the Third Reich. 
The tour will include a short coffee and bathroom break.
🐕‍🦺Please note, my dog Gilbert will usually be on this tour. He is very good with other dogs, and people.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: VIP Berlin with a Private Guide, Car, and Driver
description:
Welcome to amazing Berlin.

We are Guides of Berlin and together we will discover, understand and have a memorable experience of Berlin.

On this VIP tour, we will visit the landmarks of Berlin, go beyond the beaten track to discover the magic that lured people here throughout history.

Our driver will take us directly to the sights, avoiding queues and comfortably accessing the city sights.

Driving through wonderful Unter der Linden all the way to The German parliament--the Reichstag.

The fabulous Brandenburg Gate

The Holocaust Monument

Babel Platz--Location of the book burning

The Berlin wall

Check point Charlie

Gendarmenmarkt

The Royal City Palace

and much more.

name: Private Berlin Wall and Third Reich History 3-Hour Bike Tour
description: Enjoy a private 3-hour bike tour and experience Berlin's 20th century history off the beaten tourist trail. Learn about the capitals history during the Nazi period, the construction of The Wall and daily life in East and West shown at original places.

name: Discover Berlin with a Berliner (Available in English, Spanish)
shortDescription:
Guten Tag I'm Felipe, let me welcome you to the most fantastic city in the world - Berlin!

Come with me for your first day where I will show you the highlights of this fascinating city including lots of tips, fun facts, a bit of German and practical do's and don'ts - most importantly how to do. in front of grumpy Berliners 😉.

Berlin is a city that one never stops discovering but I am going to show you the main places and give you an invitation so that in your next few days you can go to other recommended places. Without a doubt we will go to:

  • brandenburg gate
  • Monument to the Jews
  • Bundestag
  • Museum island
  • Berlin Cathedral
  • Checkpoint Charlie.


Discover Berlin in a local and different way, see you!

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Skip-the-Line AquaDom & SEA LIFE Berlin Ticket
description: Dive into the fascinating world under the sea and experience the exciting and beautiful underwater world.

name: 2-Hour Segway Discovery Tour Berlin
description:
Visit Checkpoint Charlie, the best-known crossing point in the Berlin Wall

See the Brandenburg Gate, one of the most famous landmarks in Germany

Experience the Holocaust Memorial, a haunting tribute to the Jewish victims

name: Little Big City Berlin Entrance Ticket
description: Located at the foot of the iconic Berlin TV Tower (Berliner Fernsehturm), Little BIG City brings to life Berlin’s rich history in beautifully crafted 3D miniature sets. In just under an hour, experience seven periods of time in Berlin, from the birth of the city up to modern-day Berlin. View a magnificent cityscape of Berlin through time and discover the little stories behind the big events that shaped the city. Get closer to history than ever before at Little BIG City Berlin.

name: Berlin Historical Bike Tour: Berlin Wall and Cold War
description:
Join this extremely insightful four-hour tour, covering a leisurely 6 miles (10 kilometers) by bike. Your tour begins near Alexanderplatz where you'll area formerly known as East Berlin to visit the Wall plenty of sites that make Berlin the unique city it is today. On the Berlin Wall Bike Tour you will visit the Berlin Wall Memorial, see a former watchtower, visit the land once known as the no-man's land, see where the East German Secret Police kept their secret files, and learn about escape attempts in the places they took place.

Along the way, your guide will also tell you about ghost train stations, espionage, and world events all effected by the Wall. You'll gain insight into what life was like in the shadow of the Wall and how the city still copes with it's divided past today. Throughout the tour, your guide will be available to answer any questions you have about the Cold War and how it shaped present-day Berlin

name: The best of Berlin (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
If you want to know the best of Berlin and understand the history that sleeps in the city center, this is your best option. if you are not good at reading, you can see our video that explains the tour;) https://youtu.be/eDNQNP3_wWQ We will start on the museum island, there we will see the Dome of Berlin, the royal palace (currently Humboldt Forum) . We will talk about the 5 museums that the island owns, we will see the facade of the old museum, the old national art gallery and the Bode museum, we will also visit the James Simon Gallery. Then we will go to the "New Guard" where Kollwitz's piety is found, a sculpture that recalls the damage caused by war. We will walk along Boulevard Unter den Linden where we will see the State Opera, Humboldt University and we will arrive at Bebels Square where we will talk about the burning of books in 1933 by the Nazi party. We will go to GendarmenMart considered one of the most beautiful squares in Germany where the twin churches and the Konserthaus are located. We will visit Check Point Charlie an exact replica of an old checkpoint to cross the Berlin wall, here we will also see the Travi museum, we will walk to a segment of the Berlin wall and tell stories of how some tried to cross it. We will show the former Nazi air ministry and the place where Hitler's chancellery and Bunker used to be. We will talk about the Holocaust and cross the memorial to the Jews. We will stroll through Tiergarten (former hunting ground for the Prussian kings) to reach the Reichtag, a huge German parliament building. We will finish the tour by passing under the famous Brandenburg Gate. We wait for you :) :)

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

We will walk along Boulevard Unter den Linden where we will see the State Opera, Humboldt University and we will arrive at Bebels Square where we will talk about the burning of books in 1933 by the Nazi party. We will go to GendarmenMart considered one of the most beautiful squares in Germany where the twin churches and the Konserthaus are located. We will visit Check Point Charlie an exact replica of an old checkpoint to cross the Berlin wall, here we will also see the Travi museum, we will walk to a segment of the Berlin wall and tell stories of how some tried to cross it. We will show the former Nazi air ministry and the place where Hitler's chancellery and Bunker used to be. We will talk about the Holocaust and cross the memorial to the Jews. We will stroll through Tiergarten (former hunting ground for the Prussian kings) to reach the Reichtag, a huge German parliament building. We will finish the tour by passing under the famous Brandenburg Gate. We wait for you :) :)

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Roehhäppchen
description: Asiatisch, Modern Asiatisch, Fusion / Eklektisch

name: Berlin Bike Tour
description:
There's no better way to see the sights and learn the history of Berlin than by joining a bike tour! You get to have fun and socialize, have some exercise and be entertained by your knowledgeable guide. It will be the best day you'll spend in Berlin!

Our 6-hour, deep dive into Berlin history will take you to the major sites and give you a glimpse into modern Germany. Our guides are locals who are passionate about their city and want you to enjoy it as much as they do. Plus, we'll stop at a Beer Garden for lunch (cost not included). This is the best way to see all of Berlin in a day and gain valuable insight to the monuments that make this city unique.

name: Cecconi's Berlin
shortDescription: Italian Cecconi's Berlin is the place to be for classic Italian cuisine, perfectly located in central Berlin, just a 10-minute walk from the TV tower The restaurant serves quality pizzas, hand-made pasta, seafood platters and many other Italian dishes made from fresh ingredients The main entrance of Soho House Berlin will lead you to Cecconi’s restaurant. Here you will be welcomed in an elegant ambiance - with red leather armchairs at the bar, an open-plan kitchen, wood oven, marble floor and an outdoor terrace for dining in the warm months Opening hours: Monday – Wednesday: 6pm – 0am Thursday – Sunday: 12pm – 0am Our advice: Early reservations are highly recommended if you want to eat on the spot because this restaurant and the location are very busy, especially during dinner time. Recommended dishes: truffle pizza, octopus starter, Cacio e Pepe (cheese pasta) with truffles, eggplant lasagna, tiramisu...

name: Wild Berlin Free Walking Tour (Available in English)
description:
The Wild Berlin Tour°

Berlin has always been a wild city, and on this tour, we will explore the wild side of Berlin. We will look at history, street art, gentrification, alternative living, rock n roll, and the punk scene. We will walk through the most dynamic neighborhoods, that are constantly changing.

If you have ever wondered why Berlin is so unique, compared to other cities in Germany (or even in the World), this tour is for you, and that question will be answered on this tour.

Your guide for this tour has been a guide in Berlin for 4 years, and has experienced first hand, how this city has changed, and how the city will look in the future (for better or worse)! He prides himself on showing you parts of Berlin, you could not find on your own, and this tour is suitable for locals, and tourists alike!

This tour is in English, and we will be meeting at The World Time Clock at Alexanderplatz.
*A single AB ticket will be needed for this tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Guided tour of the Jewish Quarter of Berlin (Available in Spanish)
description:
Let's go together in one of the most important historical districts of the city of Berlin . Let's get to know the culture of the Jewish community that even before the creation of the Kingdom of Prussia already had influence within the city. We will visit very important points such as the Hackeschen Höfe (Berlin's first shopping center), the New Synagogue, the first Jewish cemetery in the city of Berlin and even the Dead Chicken Alley, a place where not only is it possible to find a lot of street art today , but also a museum that recalls an important part of the history of the neighborhood in the times of the Second World War.

What will we visit?

  • The Hackesche Höfe Courtyards
  • Grosse Hamburger Strasse
  • new synagogue
  • Heckmann Höfe Courtyards
  • sophia church
  • old jewish cemetery
  • Dead Chicken Alley
  • Otto Weidt Museum


ESTIMATED TIME OF THE VISIT
The visit lasts approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes, departing from the Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station in Berlin.

Basic and important information for the traveler.

  • You must be 10 minutes before at the meeting point.
  • The visit is only made with a minimum group of 6 people.
  • Does not require transport ticket.
  • Bring a good coat and clothing suitable for walking outdoors.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Berlin's Main Sights and Highlights, a fantastic introduction  (Available in English)
description:
Join me on foot as we explore the Main sights and Highlights of Berlin's historic Mitte district.
Find out how the city has evolved from a small fishing village on the Spree to the sprawling multi-cultural modern capital that it is today.
Berlin has been the seat of the all powerful Prussian Empire, a hotbed of revolution, a magnet for artists during the golden twenties and of course the capital of Hitler's criminal Third Reich. Divided for 28 years during the Cold War, two different cities existed side by side, separated by the Berlin Wall, reunited after the summer of the revolution and the fall of the wall.
On the tour we will visit:

  • Museum Island
  • Berlin's royal boulevard Unter den Linden 
  • Bebelplatz
  • The Brandenburg Gate
  • The Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe
  • The place of Hitler's Bunker
  • The former Luftwaffe HQ
  • An original piece of the Berlin Wall
  • Checkpoint Charlie


Useful information:

- Meet me on Museum Island, at the steps of the Altes Museum.
- The tour will finish at Checkpoint Charlie where there is ample opportunity to take photos, pick up a souvenir or a postcard, or to grab a snack. There's also an U-Bahn station 100m away from the end of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Cold War: The Berlin Wall (Available in Spanish)
description:
The Cold War, an ideological confrontation that divided the world into two blocs, was the greatest conflict that modern Europe has known.

Berlin became the place where the tension between communism and capitalism materialized.

The Berlin Wall, which was erected "overnight", was a physical division between these blocks, but also an emotional wound that separated thousands of families and loved ones for almost three decades.

Find out how this city has managed after the fall of the wall, to overcome the division and unite after decades of tension and separation.

Book your visit now!


IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • A transport ticket for AB zones is required .
  • For reservations of more than 6 people, even if they are made separately, a minimum of €10 per person must be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Jewish Quarter and its inner courtyards (Available in Spanish)
description:
Berlin's Jewish Quarter is a vibrant and characterful area that reflects the history of Judaism that has left its mark on the city since the 15th century.

On this tour, we will discover the fascinating history of this community, from its arrival in Berlin to the darkest moments of the Third Reich and the Holocaust.

Picturesque alleyways, secret inner courtyards and memorials make up this area that attracts visitors from all over the world.

Together we will explore the most authentic corners of the Jewish quarter and we will discover details that even many locals are unaware of.

Book your visit now!


IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • For reservations of more than 6 people, even if they are made separately, a minimum of €10 per person must be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Alternative Free Tour: Berlin poor but sexy! (Available in Spanish)
description:
Leave your prejudices at home and come discover the real Berlin !
In this tour we want to show you those places that do not appear in the guides and see what makes this city authentic .
Urban art, graffiti , stencil , artist groups, and incredible places hidden between monuments and historic buildings make up the most real face of this city.
We will take a tour through the history of Berlin in the 90s, when punks , squatters and artists of all kinds filled its streets.
We will talk about electronic music culture and Berlin clubs. Why are they so special? Why is it so difficult to enter? What are the essentials?

WHAT WILL WE VISIT?

In order not to lose the alternative essence of this tour, each guide offers their experience of Berlin in a tour that will not cease to amaze you.

**A minimum number of participants is required for the tour to take place**


IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • An all-day transport ticket from AB zones is required.
  • For reservations of more than 6 people , even if they are made separately, €10 per person will have to be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour .


Be dazzled by the most exciting city in Europe on a tour with an expert, entertaining guide in love with Berlin .

We wait for you!


Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Historical Tour of Berlin (Museum Island) (Available in English, Spanish, Italian)
description:
The idea of this tour was born to make the authenticity of the city known through the various changes that have taken place in Berlin over the years but above all to tell you a little piece of Berlin history. The professionalism and beauty of a place to be told start from the love for the city we live in that we never stop discovering and browsing. I'll start by talking about the Neptune Fountain and then mention the TV Tower. After introducing ourselves and starting our walking tour we will go to the Museum Island but we will first pass by the Nikolai Kirche (St. Nicholas Church) in Berlin which is not always open. If anyone wishes, they can come in for a visit. We will continue our tour on foot and visit the DDR Museum (DDR Museum) and then continue and see the other museums in Berlin that I will explain to you during our journey. It will eventually be possible to enter the museum of the GDR as well as in the church of San Nicola but always respecting the current directives especially current. I will let you know before the tour if it will be possible or not to enter one of these places. This will be possible if we are a small, small group. Of course I will inform you before or during the tour if there are any additional costs related to entry to the DDR Museum as well as for the church. We will continue our tour arriving at Unter der Linden where it will be possible to take pictures and where it will be possible to see the burning of books located in the Bebelplatz near the Humboldt University and the Berlin Opera House (Humboldt Universität und Deutsche Oper). From Unter der Linden we will continue the tour arriving up to Brandenburger Tor which I will explain in great detail. The tour ends at Brandenburger Tor where tourists can relax by taking pictures and also find some nearby restaurants. Tour themes: -Neptune Fountain -Tower of Berlin -Nikolai Kirche (Church of St. Nicholas) -DDR Museum -James Simon Galerie -Unter der Linden -Humboldt Universität -Alexander von Humboldt -Deutsche Staatoper -Bebelplatz -Brandenburger Tor


Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour through the heart of Berlin (Available in Spanish)
description:
Berlin is a fascinating and eclectic city , perfectly combining the modern and the classic.

On our tour, we will have the opportunity to discover the most emblematic places of the city, from the beautiful Museum Island and the majestic Opera Square, to the iconic Brandenburg Gate, the historic Checkpoint Charlie, Hitler's bunker and the symbolic Berlin Wall.

During this walk, we will enjoy the rich history and curiosities of Berlin , which will allow us to have a global perspective of this vibrant metropolis .

This tour is a must for those who want to get to know all the facets of Berlin in depth.

Book your visit now!

IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • For reservations of more than 6 people, even if they are made separately, a minimum of €10 per person must be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Alternative Berlin! (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Let’s set aside the old and focus on the new! For the past 20 years, Berlin has been a cultural trendsetter, a home to new and creative ideas, a place where artists and performers from all around would stream to. This tour will focus on art and music, graffiti and murals, and in general on the alternative lifestyle in which Berlin specializes. Get ready to visit places, nooks and crannies where regular tourists don't usually venture. Let’s discover together the other side of Berlin – the European cultural melting pot. 


Highlights:

  • street art
  • squat life
  • Kreuzberg
  • gentrification
  • Berlin, the city of misfits


Useful information:
Attention! A daily transport ticket (AB zone) is needed for this tour!
The last point is next to YAAM Ostbahnhof

ℹ️ ⚠️ ATTENTION - booking rules

Please note that our free tours are designed for individual travelers and small private groups only. Hence, we do not accept parties of 8 or more people on regular free tours and guides have the right to deny participation to such groups. If you travel in a party of 8 or more please book a private tour in advance.


If you show up at the meeting point with the bigger group our guide will ask you for the payment (12 eur/person) before the tour or cancel your reservation on the spot. To confirm your reservation please arrive 10 minutes before starting. We can not guarantee participation when you will be late.                                  

Please note that multiply bookings (under different names) for 7 people who belong to one group will still be treated as one organized group and the guide has the right to deny participation to such parties.

This policy is implied in the best interest of our individual visitors. 

Please respect our rules.     

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
Visit the Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp Memorial, the first Nazi camp that served as a model for others.

You'll learn how this institution of terror was meticulously crafted and understand the historical significance of the place that paradoxically came under Soviet rule after the war.

This tour is intense but informative, offering us an unprecedented glimpse into Europe's darkest age, which has inspired numerous books and films.

Join us in this unique experience that will transport you to the bowels of history.

Book your visit now!


IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • A transport ticket for ABC zones is required .
  • It is recommended to bring something light to eat and drink.
  • You must pay the entrance to the venue of €3 per person (over 14 years).
  • For reservations of more than 6 people, even if they are made separately, a minimum of €15 per person must be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Welcome to Berlin! Free tour by Walkative! (Available in German, English, Spanish)
description:
Berlin is without any doubts one of the most interesting and important cities in the world. Our tour will give you a good understanding of the city, its history and the many ideas born in Berlin that shaped this city and the entire world! We will journey in time from the humble medieval beginnings, through the capital of a mighty kingdom and empire, revolution, dark times of nazism, destruction and communist divisions up to today – the trendiest and hottest city in the world. That was truly a spectacular transition, one you should not miss! 


On the tour we will see and discuss:

  • TV tower
  • Red Town Hall and the remains of the old Berlin
  • Museum Island and the Berlin Cathedral
  • Unter Den Linden and Humboldt University
  • Gendarmenmarkt and Book Burning Sites
  • Checkpoint Charlie and Berlin Wall stories
  • Adolf Hitler’s Bunker Site
  • Jewish Holocaust Memorial
  • Brandenburg Gate


The last stop for this tour is Brandenburg Gate.

Look for the yellow umbrella at the meeting point!

ℹ️ ⚠️ ATTENTION - booking rules

The tour is fit for pets, but one site, the Holocaust Memorial, is only allowed to walk around (so you see it, but not walk through). Please have that in mind.

Please note that our free tours are designed for individual travelers and small private groups only. Hence, we do not accept parties of 8 or more people on regular free tours and guides have the right to deny participation to such groups. If you travel in a party of 8 or more please book a private tour in advance.


If you show up at the meeting point with the bigger group our guide will ask you for the payment (12 eur/person) before the tour or cancel your reservation on the spot. To confirm your reservation please arrive 10 minutes before starting. We can not guarantee participation when you will be late.                                  

Please note that multiply bookings (under different names) for 7 people who belong to one group will still be treated as one organized group and the guide has the right to deny participation to such parties.

This policy is implied in the best interest of our individual visitors. 

Please respect our rules.

name: Free Tour Potsdam from Berlin: City of Palaces (Available in Spanish)
description:
In this city everything revolves around the Hohenzollern dynasty, rulers of the Kingdom of Prussia and the most distinguished inhabitants of Potsdam
We will delve into the lives of kings and emperors, where palace plots, lovers, betrayals and dangerous friendships endow this family with one of the most interesting stories in Germany .
During our trip, we will have as a setting the monumental palaces of the monarchs and their idyllic gardens , declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO .

WHAT WILL WE VISIT?

  • New Palais
  • orangery
  • chinese tea house
  • Sanssouci
  • dutch mill
  • peace church
  • Potsdam Brandenburg Gate
  • dutch quarter


**A minimum of 6 participants is required for the tour to take place**


HOW LONG DOES IT LAST?

The tour lasts approximately 6 hours , with round trip time included

IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR THE TRAVELER:

  • A transportation ticket for ABC zones is required. I will give you advice on how and where to buy your ticket after making the reservation.
  • It is necessary to bring food and drink .
  • The palaces are not visited inside.
  • At the end of the tour, I will give you all kinds of tips and ideas on what to do in the city in your free time!
  • For reservations of more than 6 people , even if they are made separately, €15 per person will have to be paid to the guide at the beginning of the tour .

name: From Marx to the Wall: Communist & Socialist Free Tour (Available in English)
description:
Join us to learn about the most revolutionary and controversial movements in world history: welcome to the Berlin Communist & Socialist tour. The goal of the tour is to give you a deeper understanding of movements that have changed and largely shaped world history from the end of the 19th century up to the present day. From Marx and Engels, through revolution led by Luxembourg and Liebknecht, the Cold War and the Berlin Wall up to leftwing movements today.

After this 3 hours Walkative journey, you’ll form a historical Gestalt of communist & socialist ideas! Both in Germany and Europe (and even beyond). Both before and after WWII. Long before and long after.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Alternative Free Tour of Berlin (street art, techno, sex and squats) (Available in Spanish)
description:
— Very complete route to move around in Berlin like a local — Are you on Erasmus? You just moved to Berlin or you just want to get to know the city like a local, this tour is for you.


In this Free Tour we will discover together what makes this city one of the most alternative cities in the world , we will talk about techno culture, its clubs , sexual debauchery, the movement of the house squats , street art and how the wall Berlin played a major role in the origin of alternative Berlin.

We will start in Mitte (the center of the city) and little by little we will move to the Kreutzberg district, the coolest and most alternative neighborhood in the city. (we will have to take public transport, only 3 stations). We will visit places like: Hause Schwarzenberg , ("a time capsule of the Berlin of the 80s"). We will go through KitKat Club. (The most famous sex club in the city, we will also visit Tresor club (Pioneer in the Techno scene in Berlin) and we will go through Kopi , the house it occupies for more than 30 years that the German government has not yet managed to evict !!

Book now and let's tour the city together !

— Very complete route to move in Berlin like a local —

Points to see:

- Summary of general history to contextualize and introduction to alternative berlin.

- Alternative Berlin . Differences between East and West Berlin and their subsequent reunification that shapes the current Berlin.

- Hause Schwarzenberg (squatter cultural center for artists)

- kitkat (BDSM Club ), 😋
we will talk about the dress codes and the secrets for you to get in 😉

- Technical break 🍻 🙋‍♂️❓🚽: 10-15 min to go to the bathroom, drink a beer and give you the best recommendations you need 😉.

- Tresor club: Tecno de berlin, dress code, prices and everything you need to know 🤫🍬🍭

- Ampelman (Berlin traffic light) 🚦

- The problem of the current gentrification .

- Kopi: Squat: oldest in Berlin.

- the Scar on the wall. (Visible mark indicating where the wall passed)

- Yaam (recreational cultural center) 🍁🌿


— Very complete route to move in Berlin like a local - Duration 2.5 hours.—

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end
